intro: Johnstonella, commonly known as the common bluebell, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. Johnstonella has strap-like leaves and produces showy blooms in the spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
